column4: ï»¿ANYONE  know where the open in this window option is in ubuntu
when i click on a folder it opens up in a new folder window not in the one im currently in
edit -> preferences -> behavior tab -> always open in browser window
nope thats WAY worse opens in new window with full list of all other folders on left side
where are you getting the 'first' window from
any one from places comp - to home icon on desktop - cdrom folder on load in
are you using xfce or gnome?
Not too sure then, when I open a folder on the desktop, it opens in the "explorer-like" view with the list of locations on the side, which then any other folder i click open in the same window
i do have xfce downloaded also - so i can start a xfce session but gnome runs faster on this old pc
when you open the first window, go to help and about
is it running thunar or gnome
thank u thunar - i got it now all of a sudden for some reason
yeah looks like x's explorer is taking over
